verbs.description: eponymize (third-person singular simple present eponymizes, present participle eponymizing, simple past and past participle eponymized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To name (something or someone) after oneself or another entity; to give an eponym as a name.
examples: His name was eponymized in the Kelly pad for obstetrical and surgical tables, the Kelly cystoscope for visualization of the female bladder (he was the first to use air to inflate the bladder for examination and for catheterization of the ureters)  […]
